alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Swift (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 9:00AM CDT until July 23 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT FOR LAC QUI PARLE...NORTHWESTERN CHIPPEWA AND WESTERN SWIFT COUNTIES... At 859 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Artichoke Lake to 5 miles east of Bellingham to near Gary, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Appleton, Lake Oliver, Milan and Dawson. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
